website_summaries.verdict: The Creative Aurvana Live headphones offer balanced audio response and a comfortable, closed-back design that won't leak sound. They're a great choice for the average listener who wants to enjoy private audio in the home.
pros: The Aurvana Live headphones offer a comfortable design with little to no sound leakage
Sound quality is very good with a pronounced low-end, and Creative includes useful extras such as a cable extender and quarter-inch adapter
cons: The Aurvana Live's closed-back design can cause ears to sweat
The headphones don't fold down for easy transport, taking away from their portability

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are comfortable and they sound great
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are comfortable and they sound great. But they have a design flaw that puts way too much stress on the metal pins that attach to the cups. I contacted Creative Labs and they said they don't sell individual parts, but they offered me a "discount" to buy a new pair, which was 5 dollars more than what I paid for the first pair. I can't say the experience left me with much confidence in the brand - I will not be buying their products anymore. There are plenty of other decent headphones in this price range - look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Chapter 4

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These were a hidden gem. After reading reviews and watching Zeos videos I have to agree with all the positive reviews. The only thing that worries me is the build quality on these. Based on the pictures and on how they feel, it’s almost like you have to “baby” them. It’s not really a problem for me because I take care of all my headphones. Just don’t throw them around without a case. Another small issue is that the cable is attached. Small gripe but I prefer to have options. These are very decent for gaming also which is a plus. Listening to music on these are great! Just read other reviews they are pretty much spot on.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Treat this sucker like it is made of glass.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good and the it is comfortable. The ear cups barely completely covers my ears so if you have a large head then you may want to look for other headphones. This feels pretty fragile too so be extra careful about plugging, unplugging and moving this sucker around. The cord length is a bit short for me but an extension cord is included. If you aren't too worried about durability and want good sound, this is pretty good for $48.99.
customer_reviews.author: NBS

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Beat the Sound for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding headphone for music listing. I have spent several hundreds on headphones with great reviews that do not sound this good. Having said that, build quality is not the greatest and ear pads or just big enough to go over my ear. One has to keep in mind the great sound quality for the price. Update: Had to replace the ear pads, uncomfortable for long periods. Changing ear pads changes the sound and I used leather ear pads to replicate the original pads. Plugged these headphones into my Cavalli Tube Hybrid amp using an Aune DAC and listing to music is enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: JO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality, medium build quality
customer_reviews.text: The frequency response of this hp is really good. If you are a frequent Innerfidelity reader, you will be surprise by the balance of frequency that this thing put out. Music sound just right, without getting bloated or sibilant. Though the bass maybe a little bit undefined due to more distortion in the bass region. With that being said, the bass level is just nice, almost perfect. Comparing to another different hp which is the hifiman 560. CAL doesnt reveal as much detail as the hfm. However, one will get more enjoyment from the music since CAL does closer to speaker response. All being said, you have to be careful handling these thing since it's quite plasticky.
customer_reviews.author: Ultracer

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: These have really solid sound and are very comfortable. I have a large head (7 and 7/8 hat) so the pressure added up after a couple hours. The band and ear cups are great, just a little small for my ears which aren't as ridiculously sized as my head circumference, that's why I go 4 stars. They don't claim to be sound cancelling, so I won't take points off for the fact that they aren't. I sit close to an air conditioner, which does interfere with podcasts, less of an issue with music. I'm happy with them for now, but I will be upgrading at some point. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: tom hall

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the best headphones you can get at this price point, and probably twice as expensive too.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best headphones you can get at this price point, and probably twice as expensive too. These are light, comfortable, look good, and my favorite I've ever found at less than $100. I owned a pair of ultrasone hfi-780 (~$300 headphones) that were stolen and I replaced them with these. The sound quality isn't quite as good but it was scarily close, and they are much more comfortable. 5 years later and I've never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Joel S.

customer_reviews.title: Disposable Quality
customer_reviews.text: How disappointing that the bass performance started to degrade into collapse, conveniently for the manufacturer, only one month after the return window closed. It's a shame, as the remainder of the spectrum sounds very nice for V-shaped tone, especially for this price point. Dynamics weren't too bad either. But as others have mentioned, they are very cheaply made, the cord is too short and feels terribly fragile, and the headband starts to cause physical pain on a small area of the very top of the head after less than one hour's use.
customer_reviews.author: zwhit

customer_reviews.title: Broke after moderate use for less than 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones didn't last 2 years before they broke. There is a design flaw where the ear cup attaches to the headband in that it is a SMALL piece of plastic that is subject to wear and fatigue. The sound was great but for the price these are not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Cloyd R.

customer_reviews.title: One of the best budget headphones to compete with higher end headphones.
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING HEADPHONES! These are probably 90% as good as high end Fostex headphones. If $500 is worth the extra 10% in performance is worth it for you then get those instead. But these have the value and sound quality to compete with $400 or less headphones. However, do not get the 2 as those sound worse and more expensive than these.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Giant Killer
customer_reviews.text: If you want a pair of headphones that have a sonic signature in the family of HD 600 650, then these original CAL will save you hundreds to get something similar in sound. Good bass, neutral mids and descent soundstage. To get better you need to spend over $200. Terrific bargain for headfi enthusiasts on a realistic budget.
customer_reviews.author: Marone Khmer

customer_reviews.title: Bose without noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I got mine for 60 $. Starter audiophile. Friend has bose and these are quite similar in design and sound. Pros- fully circumaurual -excellent soundstage -textured bass -very lightweight -excessively padded earcups -Durable, dropped mine quite a few times -fairly padded headband -incredibly detailed for price -black and silver stylish creative on earcup -solid click on adjustment of headband -earcups swivel several directions Cons-Fairly bass heavy -laid back almost veiled sound -padding touches ears causing them to heat up -mostly plastic design -straight plug -thin cable dont let puppies chew on it like I did. -Black plastic earcups fingerprint and scratch fairly easy -Doesnt block much outside noise In short I think these are an awesome at home circumaurul.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Evans

customer_reviews.title: These are great cheap headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are great cheap headphones, only thing I will say is if you wear them for a long period of time you will get an indent on your head from in pushing down on the skin on your head. But, these are really comfortable and the indent is really just your skin being pushed in by them but you don't feel a thing and it goes away quickly. I wouldn't be giving them a five star if I thought this effected me or their comfort level.
customer_reviews.author: kq33

customer_reviews.title: and I'm still getting very good sound from it
customer_reviews.text: Have used them at my office job on their old ass Dells, and I'm still getting very good sound from it. Seems to have a nice V shape. Sub-basses come out well, and doesn't muddle up with the low basses. And highs, like lady voices, tend to hover above it, which sounds just right.
customer_reviews.author: Ramone W

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and very comfortable to wear with glasses, but brittle build quality.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great, they sound amazing for closed back $70 headphones. They are very comfortable to wear with glasses, I can wear these for 8 hours and not be uncomfortable. The only downside is they are pretty brittle headphones. Plan on being extra careful with these, or somehow figure out how to protect them. I might try wrapping some of the plastic with tape to reinforce it a bit. Honestly these are the only comfortable closed back head phones I could find to use with my glasses so I think the trade off for the brittle build quality if worth it. (The headband is the brittle part, not the ear cups themselves).
customer_reviews.author: Roger Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Irreplaceable
customer_reviews.text: I have had these headphones for about a week now, and the shift from on the ear to over the ear headphones was drastic. Headphones are entirely unnoticeable while they are on, and leatherette padding on both the earpieces and the headpiece is incredibly comfortable. Sound quality is absolutely divine, making listening to music an incredible experience. In fact, it is possible to hear minute details that were previously hard to hear with inferior headphones. What makes these headphones especially unique is that the sound quality for the price is an absolute bargain. For $55 the sound quality is better than some celebrity endorsed headphones that cost almost triple or quadruple the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Abbas Raza

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable to wear, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it had good reviews but its very bad and not worth the price at all. Its poorly made, and incredibly uncomfortable to wear. It presses really hard into the top of your head and you feel bad after about an hour (or sometimes even less) and you'll have to take a break. The sound quality is pretty good, and there's no sound leakage, but that's pretty much the only positives I can give it. Just today after only about 2 months of having it one of the earmuffs just fell off. (And I take very good care of it mind you) So yeah, just a piece of crap tbh.
customer_reviews.author: wendy nowack

customer_reviews.title: Left earpad fell off within 4 days
customer_reviews.text: Within four days of using these headphones, the left earpad fell off. Even when it was still attached, the volume on these headphones was lower than any other pair of headphones I’ve ever owned. This product should be taken off the market. Amazon has really gone downhill. They don’t vet products, they let any old garbage get sold. Shameful.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good basic headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my PC to listen to lectures, movies, and games without disturbing others. Ok for music, too, but I'm not an aficionado. Cord is standard 5ft. I bought a 6ft extension rather than go wireless. Happy w that decision. For the money, reduces outside noise ok. Could be better, but that would also make it heavier, so I'm satisfied with it as is. Comfortable. Fits over and around my ears rather than on top. Not too warm. I can wear for hours. Wish the cord were metal braid to protect from my crazy cats.
customer_reviews.author: Blind Bartameus

customer_reviews.title: Best budget headphones
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are a bargain. The sound quality is great. However, just about anything else is sacrificed. The build quality is flimsy, the looks I guess are up to personal taste. I personally like the look of these headphones. The earcups are shiny, so they do attract fingerprints. Also, the earpads look and feel like they're made out of a sofa or a car seat. After a couple or few hours, having these on your head will annoy you. But for the price, you can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Will only last a year and a half....
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually review Amazon purchases, but I'm so bummed about these headphones that I had to review these. The sound quality of these headphones is good but ultimately, they are not worth the price. They will only last you a year and a half at the most and will likely break at the point that the ear piece meets the headband. This is the second pair of headphones and both times they've broken at the same part, right above the left ear piece. *shrugs* It's just going to waste your time and money to purchase these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, built horribly
customer_reviews.text: I'll start this by saying I absolutely love these headphones. The sound is phenomena for 50$. But I do have 1 major problem. They are build terribly, after 4 months of use the left side all of a sudden stopped working to what I assume was a lose cable after opening them up. I will be buying a new pair but this is still a major flaw.
customer_reviews.author: kiwiboy31

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable in the world
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are probably the most comfortable headphones I have ever used. I own the likes of Audio Technica, Sennhesider HD650 and up, Beyer Dynamic and the sorts.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P Piening

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, only one minor problem for me.
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've ever used. I used to spend $60-80 on "gaming headphones." I regret ever spending my money on those. These headphones handle mids and highs spectacularly, and still manage to keep a decent amount of the low spectrum. For the price, these would be hard to beat. I've dropped these multiple times and they're still holding up. The only gripe I would have is the rubber surrounding the plug (on the actual headphone portion and the female portion of extension) slid off after only a couple weeks. They must not use very good glue, but I was able to just superglue them back on.
customer_reviews.author: David LaBelle

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually a Sennheiser guy and I was actually shopping for one but I couldn't find a headphone from Sennheiser that fit my criteria. It must be a sealed phone under $100. I don't like the earbuds or in-ear phones, their on-ear phones are too small, and their around the ear phones are way too big. Good thing I came across this product and trusted the reviews of the Amazon community. This sealed phone is just the right size and price. It sounds great and so comfortable even with my eyeglasses on.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Y. C.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and sound great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace Sony XB500s that were stolen. While the Creative headphones do not have the extra bass like the Sony's, the audio from the Creative Aurvana Live headphones is very good. The highs, mids, and lows come through nicely and uniformly. They are over the ear headphones and are very well cushioned both around the earpieces as well as the headpiece. I'm very happy with the purchase and highly recommend these headphones for the mid-price range.
customer_reviews.author: Table_for_5

customer_reviews.title: Ya ya ya ya ya
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, work as advertised. I'm no audiophile, but they sound good and fit comfortably, and the extension cord is *just* long enough that I can plug the adapter into my receiver and still have the headphones reach comfortably to my couch. Good purchase, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Found these a while back and could not believe the price break at the time going for $55. One of my good friends owned a pair and he allowed me to sample them. I was very impressed with the level of detail. My only qualms were that despite the detail and overall balance provided, the bass end lacks a certain presence at times and that I felt that they did not warrant a $100-150 price tag. The price I found them for on Amazon was certainly a steal. If you should come across them for said price or better, it would be a crime not to grab a pair, as they are more than worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Pimpin aint Easy?

customer_reviews.title: Creative Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Saw this as an offer from Creative itself. Loved them! Great buy. I believe their original price was over $100, but I got them for $50+. Excellent sound quality. Bought them for my electric keyboard to practice piano and nobody could hear me. Creates isolated environment so I feel like I don't have any headphones on, but at the same time no sound can get it and nobody can bother me during the practices. I love Creative products!
customer_reviews.author: Arie N.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these maybe four or five years ago and needed to replace them. I bought them again because the sound is amazing for $60. Great balance of lows mids and highs. Provides a nice thump but not muddy at all. However the headphone jack broke on my last pair. The wires were exposed and sound only came through one ear. I fixed it by soldering another jack but it broke again like 4 months later. Anyway I didn't take great care of them then but where the wire meets the jack is definitely the most vulnerable part of the headphones and should be taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Bucky

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality, super comfortable, very light, minimal sound bleed - my go-to headphones for when I'm out and about.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best sound quality for its price but poor isolation.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are amazing for its price. I am glad I did my research and selected this one. About two weeks after I got these, I got the Beats Solo 2 which was praised by Tyll for my birthday. Even though the Solo 2 blocks out background sound better (isolation), the CAL sounds much more clearer and precise than the $200 headphone. If you plan on using your headphones in a noisy environment, I'd suggest looking somewhere else, but nothing can beat the sound quality at this price. If your budget goes up to let's say $150-ish, try taking a look at the ATH-M50x.
customer_reviews.author: inspiredtolive

customer_reviews.title: I Would Recommend. Great Quality for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for a good price. This is my second pair I bought because one of the earphones broke from the head band, but they lasted me nearly two years or a little less. Nice highs and lows. I would highly recommend these to people on a lower budget. Shipping was pretty quick too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Sound too empty for me
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these headphones because they're so comfortable and I considered them to be a big investment, and have come back to them a few times just to be disappointed each time by the lack of bass. I understand that these have a reputation as more analytical rather than having a kind of signature sound, but there's no oomph in my music when I listen to these. For over the head headphones, I much prefer the $25 JVC HAS400s, which are not basshead headphones by any means but are just overall much more fun to listen to than these.
customer_reviews.author: WN12

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap cans!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are actually rebranded Denon AH-D1001 headphones, and the sq is fantastic. The bass is nice and boomy, the mids seem a bit pushed forward, and the highs are pretty clear. Overall I like the sound. They nicely complement my Denon AH-D2000 headphones. A steal for the price I paid, which was under $60. I forgot to mention why they get 4 stars instead of 5. The build quality is good, but not 5 star good. Be gentle with them and they'll last you, be rough and you'll be getting another set. Still, for what you get, they really ROCK!
customer_reviews.author: tds101

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones for the price tag!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these because my gaming headset while good for gaming sucked when it comes to music, for 50$ there are no better options than these, highs and mids are crystal clear, could however use a little more bass and the build quality is questionable to me but I've put them in my pockets to work with me and it seems to be working fine still so no real complaint here. Great headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Bernier

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: And bass boom for the buck. Btw, Brainwavz angled oval pads fit on these.
customer_reviews.author: kinnikuren

customer_reviews.title: I can say that I've been pleasantly surprised and more than happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've had these cans for several months now. I read a lot of reviews and customer feedback before the purchase. I was actually in the market for a more expensive set of cans, but then ran across the CALS. For the price (and considering the reviews and feedback) figured I didn't have anything to lose. I can say that I've been pleasantly surprised and more than happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: wevsspot

customer_reviews.title: Earpiece falls off
customer_reviews.text: One of the cushions for the earpiece fell off. I bought a sexond pair because i figured that it was just a fluke but rhe earpiece fell off on that pair as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mcintyre

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, more so after I replaced the ear cups ...
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, more so after I replaced the ear cups with velour, good sound, and under $100. What's not to like? Ed: should mention I paired the headphones with this $9 mic for VOIP. Required a little electrical tape to pad the headphones' wire so the mic remains attached. Both have experienced heavy, daily use for two years. I've abused thetwo cords on a regular basis with feet, rolling desk chair, yanking, etc. Still in good shape, and I think both sound better than any combination headset I've tried. Ed: I think these are the pads I attached to replace the stock earpads. P.S. This review is for the original headphones. I have no experience with the 2nd version.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Irving

customer_reviews.title: Even better with a small mod
customer_reviews.text: Got these phones for $67 in a previous sale. Really like them, and they are especially good amped out of my iPod Classic (though the also sound very good from the iPhone 4). One small mod made them even better, after a friend and CAL owner suggested it. I snipped the inner foam inside the headpieces and the CALs are even clearer than stock. Excellent mod, and not a penny spent. I would love to recable them too, but as they are, very very good.
customer_reviews.author: Stuff Lover

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound, Easy to Take Apart
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace a very old and worn out hand me down pair. Great sound for my purposes (gaming, some music) and very easy to disassemble and reassemble for painting - and later removal of the paint since it didn't turn out as I'd planned. Padding on the ear cups is nice although the headpiece is uncomfortable after 5+ hours of wear. That's my sole complaint though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unbiased Review
customer_reviews.text: I find that these headphones do a good job at dealing with both low and high freq. where some cheap head phones only focus on one side of the spectrum. In term of extras no mic, extension and 1/4 and a carry bag. Does not fold and sits with a comfortable tightness on the head. For the price I would say these, are good headphones and should be considered over most other competitors in this price bracket. Highs could use a bit of eq.
customer_reviews.author: TOP 10 REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: I keep buying them because they sound awesome. However this latest pair I got has less ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing build quality. This is my 4th pair. I keep buying them because they sound awesome. However this latest pair I got has less padding in the headband and the leather is all wrinkled. I considered sending them back just for that, but the sound is still excellent. I am not sure if they changed how they are built, but it is disappointing to see the lower quality.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Bad build = fail
customer_reviews.text: I like my headphones. I buy headphones on impulse. I plug headphones into headphone amps. I have a bit of a headphone fetish. This headphone is good, it's balanced, and doesn't over color, either way. However, it is fragile, and broke after 2 uses. Creative - build something more solid and perhaps it's worth a revisit.
customer_reviews.author: Edward T.

customer_reviews.title: Freedom
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the wife who kept stealing my earbuds to listen to her IPad. She loves them I no longer have to search the house for my buds, hence the five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday present from my boyfriend. He did a careful examination of many headphones, until he reached this one for the price range. I believe this is far greater than the price it offers. Overall, this has a very balanced sound. I am no expert, but I found classic, opera, techno music to sound great, esp. with the extra cord that came with it to improve the sound quality. There is no base. So it does feel like it is missing a little bit for hiphop, but then again, I don't think it is misleading about that on the description.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are really solid mid-range headphones in both price and quality. I'd say they're some of the best you can get for under a hundred bucks. They're quite comfortable and easily fit over the entire ear. I can leave them on for hours without my ears getting sore. The sound quality is solid and fairly balanced without focusing to heavily on any one element.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smithe

customer_reviews.title: Truly amazing sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I find it hard to buy headphones based on reviews as sound is subjective. This is a time where I am glad I bought. They sound so good that I bought one as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound, but a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: You will be amazed at the sound coming out of these cans. Great sound at a great price. Almost unbelievable. Pretty comfortable for long listening sessions. My only complaint is that the built quality is a little cheap. If you listen at home or at the office and don't travel much, they'll be perfect. The only other thing I should mention is about the "Y" style cords. It's a matter of preference, but a single cord coming from the left side of the headphones gives you less sound interference and is less intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Chad McClung

customer_reviews.title: The CAL is the best in its price range
customer_reviews.text: The CAL is a great headphone and is nearly impossible to beat for the price. Just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound qaulity brought them with me on a 2 week trip across Mexico and they still doing just fine only things I have to warn you about is the comfort and noise isolation isn't the best but it did an ok job. If you're a bass lover definitely get these.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: My go-to portable set.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people say this cans have terrible build quality. It's flimsy, but not the worst build quality in the world. If one were to step on it without trying to apply a good amount of force, it'd survive. I absolutely love these headphones, they give a relatively warm/sweet sound (more bass and mids). The pads do however feel almost like on ears and are somewhat shallow. Aside from complaints about pleather pads in general, I have none. These are really soft, and unlike the other pleather padded cans I've owned, they don't get stiffer when exposed to moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Simply Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: First thing I did to test these out was play Battlefield 3. These headphones single handedly made me love that game. I prefer to use these headphones than my own surround sound. Movies, music, games, it works great. It has a very good range and quite an amount of base too. And, they are pretty comfortable too. Though wear it for too long (3+ hours) and it might start getting uncomfortable. I am not an audiophile and I am not familiar with the capabilities of other much more distinguished headphone brands that audiophiles typically use. However, I am a regular customer, and for me, these headphones are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Solid headphones for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones but will break eventually if you take them off and put them back on too frequently because of the way they are connected to the headband. Had my last pair for two years so I'd say that's not a bad run. Comfortable on the ears but the headband does get a little uncomfortable if wearing for long periods of time. I am not a sound nerd but it's clear and I've never had problems with buzzing or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: Shane King

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound stage & quality for the price. Very lightweight and comfortable. Warm sound profile.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My first venture into headphones over $20. LOVE them. Full, rich, deep bass. Good mids and highs. Nothing stands out as out of balance. Fits on my really, really big head comfortably. I appreciate the short attached cord with the included extension. Very manageable this way. I use them for gaming, music (varied from classic rock, modern electronic, large orchestra classical and solo piano), audio creation/editing. Works well for all uses.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: I don't understand why I don't love them anymore
customer_reviews.text: Good, but not as good as i remember my first pair.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Jedi

customer_reviews.title: nice sounding headphones you can afford.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of digging into reviews for headphones under a $100 and this is the only pair that got overall solid reviews. I agree. they sound really nice for a bargain headphone. maybe a little weak on the midrange but that is getting better as I use them more. the bass response is quite respectable, the earphones fit comfortably and they don't cook yours ears after an hour of listening like some bargain headphones do. they could use a little padding on top so I taped a sports headband to them to provide cushion. problem solved. for the casual home listener I don't think you'll find better for the money. I know. I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: S. doyle

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome, has loose bass and sounds muddy without mods
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome, has loose bass and sounds muddy without mods, but after you mod them (instructions can be found at head-fi) these things really improve alot, these are worth a lot more than their price. Soundstage would be one of the best for closed can at a price below 200, not even the momentum stages this well
customer_reviews.author: zulk

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is fantastic, and they are comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: I treasure these headphones. The sound quality is fantastic, and they are comfortable to wear. Full marks!
customer_reviews.author: Randall G. Hauk

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I thought these may block out more noise than they do. They are very comfortable and work well for my meditation sessions when my surroundings are quiet but not so great when there is noise around if that is what you need them for.
customer_reviews.author: newnana

customer_reviews.title: One of the best at any price
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what else to say. They have great sound and a pleasant fit. Bass is deep and even, midrange is present and clear, treble is fairly well balanced. For the money they definitely can't be beat(no pun). Not sure there is a better sounding over the ear headphone at all.
customer_reviews.author: DanTheMan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are extremely high quality for their price. The only con is that the noise cancellation isn't great, so I wouldn't recommend using this brand on a plane or anywhere else with a lot of background noise. However, the audio quality is amazing and I'll definitely keep purchasing from Aurvana.
customer_reviews.author: Michael DeKock

customer_reviews.title: There are better headphones but this one is great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good quality headphone which I can wear for a long time and minimum sound leaking. I don't want to bother others in house while listening music. Treble is great and clear and nobody around me can realize I am listening song at high volume. About comfort, only Bose looks more comfortable than this one. If you have the money, go for that. But this one is great value for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Yeameen

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: These are okay for music by themselves but then I turned on the SRS Premium 3D sound and was pretty blown away! Not sure if that program came with my laptop but I recommend it because had presets for music and movie and you can adjust yourself if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These are my first full sized headphones. They are in comparable in sound to the Bose QC15s. Mids and lows are very good. The sound is very clear and the bass is quite good. There's little to no sound leakage. I wish the cable was removable and that they folded, but otherwise, these are very exceptional headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Stiven Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING CANS!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I just don't think you can get a better sounding set of cans. Living in an apartment I can't play loud music so these are excellent! clean highs, fantastic lows that don't muddy the rest of the spectrum. And super comfy to wear for hours on end without my ears getting warm or fatigued. Fantastic cans! Easily competing with headphones twice the price and more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Orzel

customer_reviews.title: If you intend to play games these are perfect because you will be able to pinpoint where your ...
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are incredible. The soundstage is absolutely massive. If you intend to play games these are perfect because you will be able to pinpoint where your enemies are in games like Counter Strike. Music sounds incredible in these too. I'm not really an audiophile but since I got these I've been listening to .flac and I can really hear the difference. These really allow me to appreciate the music more.
customer_reviews.author: Aleks baumann

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding sound, improved them by using Shure SRH840 earpads.
customer_reviews.text: My only problem was the fit because I have HUGE ears, solved the problem by using earpads from Shure SRH840 that I had laying around. Love the sound, one thing is I do believe these benefit from using an amplifier because they don't sound the best off my iPod's headphone jack.
customer_reviews.author: cmarti

customer_reviews.title: Great headphone for home listening
customer_reviews.text: Pro -Bass is slightly more than mid and high, which is great for general music -Good soundstage for a closed can -Great value (bought it at ~$60) -Good comfort without head crushing. Con -Ear pad is small for my ear and may become warm after long listening in summer -some isolation (good enough for home use) but not enough for blocking out public noise -No mic or button for portable use -not foldable Good value and quality sound headphone for home use. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bri3fcas3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value for the price. The biocellulose driver sounds silky smooth, something special about the way it produces sound. Comfort is alright.. Worth adding to your collection!
customer_reviews.author: Krisna Overton

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and acoustic
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones with great sound, the materials look a little cheap but seems durable, I have the headphone for six months and it is intact, the sound is superb e very comfortable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Augusto Carvalho de Almeida

customer_reviews.title: One of the best over the ear headphones I've ever listened to
customer_reviews.text: One of the best over the ear headphones I've ever listened to. Highs are clear and not sibilant, lows aren't overwhelming. If I didn't know better I'd mistake these for reference headphones. Bit of a cheap plasticky feel, but it doesn't rattle so I'm not inclined to take a star off for it.
customer_reviews.author: dtjoslin

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These worked very well for me. Very comfortable fit around my ears even with my big head. Only drawback is the cord is a little short, but I already had extensions so no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Schwandt

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best value in headphones out there. Incredible sound for $50. Very punchy bass. A bit flimsy, and comfort could vary depending on your ear size.
customer_reviews.author: K.P.

customer_reviews.title: Sound great and for the most part were very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sound great and for the most part were very comfortable. My biggest issue is that they are very easy to break, mine only lasted 9 months. So if you are going to buy them be very careful with them. Even though these headphones are pretty easy break they were great for the 9 months i had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice portable headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are light, comfortable, and sound great. People all over the internet pretty much love them. Now, here's the picky part. I really dug these, especially for the comfort, I did find the sound to be too warm, almost syrupy. I like a more detailed uncolored sound. Most of you are probably not as picky as I am. (By the way, don't buy the Bose headphones that are similar. The Creatives are constructed better and sound better.) There aren't many portable heaphones out there that have this combination of comfort , light weight, and sound at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: S. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Seem good
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty lightweight headphones. I got them for my 14-year old who is into electronic music. He likes them and says they have a good sound and are comfortable to wear. They are not real portable because they don't fold down but they seem to be quite a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was looking for. I bought these as a gaming/music over the ear headphones. Sound quality is pretty good for the price but i felt the construction was somewhat plastic feeling. Also the comfort was not for me. I have big ears and these did not fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Culver

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use these at work to listen to music on a daily basis and so far I have very little to complain about. I find that the cord is long enough to reach my computer under the desk. The sound is very good and I feel it makes the music sound great. They fit over the ears nicely and comfortably. The only real con I can add to these is that my ears do tend to get a bit warm after wearing them for a couple of hours, not as bad as I have had with other headphones but enough that I notice it. All in all, though, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kristie

customer_reviews.title: So far so great
customer_reviews.text: Simple in design but great in sound. After doing a brief research on what were the best headphones in the market, I arrived to an specialist webpage, there he compared many brands, with a huge range of prices. Creative Aurvana headphones were NOT ranked among the first places, but in words of this specialist they were one of the best price/value combinations in the market. After listening to its sound I completely agree.
customer_reviews.author: fernando

customer_reviews.title: Good value and performance.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are among the best I've ever used. They sound so much better than they look, and they are comfortable to wear, but their strength in in the quality of the sound. Most headphones are either deficient in the bass, or are boomy, but the bass is amazingly good, and the whole frequency range is quite accurate and satisfying. I highly recommend them, and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Bates

customer_reviews.title: Is possible to get better bass with comparable price
customer_reviews.text: Is possible to get better bass with comparable price. I believe a coworker had a pair of Sony cans that outperformed for possibly a lower price. Sorry I don't know the model. Otherwise, work perfectly. Noise reduction is great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Langeberg

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are comfortable, fit around my ears perfectly, and produce good sound. I couldn't be happier with this purchase, especially considering the cost.
customer_reviews.author: mylasthope

customer_reviews.title: Sound great.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound but to small for my ears. Ended up sending them back because of the size not because of the sound. These really compare with and better many $150 and up headphones. If they fit you will not be disappointed, especially because of the price.
customer_reviews.author: William B Manns

customer_reviews.title: Held together with a small piece of plastic which is easily breakable. Almost impossible to get customer support by ...
customer_reviews.text: Ear piece broke off the headphone after less than 2 months of normal use. Held together with a small piece of plastic which is easily breakable. Almost impossible to get customer support by phone. After contacting them by e-mail, Creative not only did not honor its warranty, it also refused to reply with an explanation. Totally unacceptable customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Sanford Cohn

customer_reviews.title: broke in less than 6 months customer service no number ...
customer_reviews.text: broke in less than 6 months customer service no number to call and refused to replace
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great, but too small!
customer_reviews.text: They sound amazing, I'm new to the audiophile world but they don't even sound like you have headphones on, it's like you're right in the middle of a movie theater. But, as I'm sure happens with others, I have to buy oval earpads because my ears don't find into circular earpads, but these are absolutely tiny! My ears couldn't fit inside of them so they beat down upon my ears and are very uncomfortable, I will have to return these. If you don't have large ears though you will probably love these, they are very comfortable and have almost no noticeable grip to them.
customer_reviews.author: deanna

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones! I'm not much of an audiophile (yet), but here are my 2 cents anyway: Pros - Sound quality (very clear with decent bass; does not sound as good as the Sony MDR-V6) - Light-weight (some might say this lends a cheap feeling, but it definitely helps if - Stylish Cons - Plastic build
customer_reviews.author: Tina Dao

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading reviews and buy these!!!
customer_reviews.text: Phenomenal headphones that reviews do it justice. Sound quality for value is fantastic. Comfort is wonderful for hours on end as it fits around ears. Only issue is sound occasionally has to be turned up/down at first to engage both speakers. Size and price of Beats make these headphones are far superior alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Burns

customer_reviews.title: ... less than a year of use - they were good acoustically for their price point
customer_reviews.text: Earpiece broke off the headphone after less than a year of use - they were good acoustically for their price point, but this is the first pair of headphones over $50 I've had mechanically fail in under a year. One side stopped swiveling, and when I tried to move it it snapped.
customer_reviews.author: David Yeaton-Massey

customer_reviews.title: The best sounding headphones I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are the best I have ever bought. The mix is perfect with great quality in the low range. They are a little lose on the head but the cans are very comfortable. I could wear these every day all day. If you buy these you will not be let down. The sound quality for only 100 bucks is amazing. Don't buy over priced fancy branded headphones that have way to much boosted bass EQ. If you haven't heard of creative before I am here to say that they are a legit brand. If you want to save money and get amazing quality, get these!
customer_reviews.author: lishlish

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This headphones are the best you can find for the price
customer_reviews.author: Iván

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound. Better than my old Senheiser HD 202's and I thought the bass on them was good. Comfortable fitting and great looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cans for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great cans for a beginner, blocks out noise, fits right, nice sound quality. Perfect for work, unless you like it ear bleeding loud in which case the noise can leak out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fun headphone
customer_reviews.text: Great headphone. Very fun to listen to. Very smooth sounding. Not made from best materials though. Very cheap plastic that seems like it would break easily. The sound though is so worth it. One of the best headphones under 150 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kimura

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are very good sound quality for the price. I wear them at work for hours at a time and they are very comfortable. Extension cord comes in handy if you are working on a desktop or something that has an aux input kind of far away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headphones worked great sound quality was the best available for the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Headphones worked great sound quality was the best available for the price at the time. Unfortunately after less than 2 years of moderate use they stopped working. No sound comes out of the left speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: These are supposed to to be one of the best sounding earphones under $100 and they don't disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Did my research. These are supposed to to be one of the best sounding earphones under $100 and they don't disappoint. Bought these and a Zalman Mic to use as a gaming headset.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

product_meta.title: Creative Aurvana Live! Over-The-Ear Headset with High-Definition Audio
feature_bullets: 40mm neodymium magnet driver with composite bio-cellulose diaphragm for faithful playback. Connectivity Technology: Wired
High-grade, supple leatherette ear pads provide unmatched comfort and an excellent seal against external noise
Includes a 1.5m (5 ft.) extension cable and 6.3mm (1/4") adapter for connection to home stereo equipment
Lightweight design for music enthusiasts on the move
Oxygen-Free Copper (OFC) cable and gold-plated plug deliver pristine performance
40mm neodymium magnet driver with composite bio-cellulose diaphragm for faithful playback
High-grade, supple leatherette earpads provide unmatched comfort and an excellent seal against external noise
